We were interested in the possibility that the stabilizing effect of hydrogen-bonds on BQ anions could enable them to perform a similar function to H 2Q for co-electrocatalytic O 2 reduction. One advantage would be that these intermediates would be comprised of highly reversible interactions, minimizing the height of any new kinetic barriers in the co-electrocatalytic mechanism. In MeCN, the p K a(1) and p K a(2) of H 2Q have been estimated computationally to be 26.20 and 40.96, respectively.
